verbose_text: These results show that Stasimon deficiency does not induce stabilization and nuclear accumulation of p53 in mammalian cells; however, loss of Stasimon is sufficient to induce N-terminal phosphorylation of p53 when converging with pre-existing mechanisms of p53 upregulation, mechanistically paralleling the paradigm driving degeneration of motor neurons in the SMA mouse model.
evidence: Stasimon is sufficient to induce N-terminal phosphorylation of p53
